intro: Plagiobothrys collinus var. gracilis, commonly known as the slenderleaf sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in open, sunny habitats such as coastal dunes and inland valleys. Its flowers are usually pale blue to purple and bloom in late spring to early summer. The variety *gracilis* is distinguished by its slender leaves and compact growth habit compared to other varieties of *Plagiobothrys collinus*.
